definition: overcast (weather)/cloudy/shady/Yin (the negative principle of Yin and Yang)/negative (electric.)/feminine/moon/implicit/hidden/genitalia

sentences.english: Thereal Chinaman may be cunning, but there is no malignity in his cunning.
sentences.chinese: 真正的中国人也许狡猾，但狡猾中并无阴险。

sentences.english: AS a viper, stopped at no evils.
sentences.chinese: 那个阴险的家伙心如蛇蝎，无恶不作。

sentences.english: Elizabeth Wong, 37, said it was an insidious and underhanded attempt to smear her reputation.
sentences.chinese: 黄洁冰说，这种做法阴险卑鄙，是想破坏她的名誉。

sentences.english: The sewer is treacherous and tells tales of you.
sentences.chinese: 阴沟是阴险的，可以告发你。

sentences.english: Don't trust that back-stabbing guy; he'll steal your money as soon as he has a chance.
sentences.chinese: 不要相信那个阴险的小人，他一有机会就会偷你的钱。

sentences.english: Li Fucai was sinister and sensuous. He was the cruelest man around.
sentences.chinese: 李富财阴险调皮，并且但愿享受，是远近最暴虐的人。

sentences.english: But in his heart he was very sinister and ruthless.
sentences.chinese: 但是，内心深处却十分阴险毒辣。

sentences.english: Is it that insidious smile with which our petition has been lately received?
sentences.chinese: 我们的请愿最近被接受，那是阴险的微笑吗？
我知道你这人阴险狡猾。

sentences.english: Do women deserve their reputation for cattiness and backbiting?
sentences.chinese: 这样的阴险和中伤朋友是否对得起自己的地位？

sentences.english: But the truth is much more sinister.
sentences.chinese: 但事实真相却要阴险险恶得多。

sentences.english: The prey was crafty and on its guard.
sentences.chinese: 那猎物是阴险的，它有所提防。

sentences.english: That insidious man bad-mouthed me to almost everyone else.
sentences.chinese: 那个阴险的家伙几乎见人便说我的坏话。

sentences.english: That insidious man bad-mouthed me to almost everyone else.
sentences.chinese: 他是我遇到的人中最阴险狡诈的一个。

sentences.english: He wickedly took advantage of their urgent need for hlep.
sentences.chinese: 他阴险地利用了他们急需要帮助的心情。

sentences.english: Television news programming is especially insidious.
sentences.chinese: 电视新闻制作尤其阴险。

definition: deceitful in many ways (idiom); wily and mischievous/full of craft and cunning
